RESOLVED_ENTITIES.U.S. Code Cong. & Admin.News: Official publication of US Congressional and Administrative materials

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Juventino Mejia-Orosco: Defendant convicted of illegally transporting aliens into the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: Court that imposes sentences, judges witness credibility, has fact-finding power in sentencing procedure, and is subject to review by the court of appeals
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Sentencing Commission: Promulgated guidelines for sentencing used by the district court in calculating Juventino Mejia-Orosco's sentence, responsible for guidelines used in sentencing, specifies guidelines for sentencing
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals: Reviews the record, determines sentence validity, and remands cases for further sentencing proceedings if necessary
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Congress: Legislative body that enacted sentencing guidelines to reduce disparity in punishment and ensure fair sentences
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Senate Report: Official report of the US Senate
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Official publication of US Congressional: Compilation of official US Congressional and Administrative documents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Sentencing Commission Guid: Guidelines providing a framework for district courts to impose sentences, considering various factors for fairness and appropriateness
